oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter of D. M. Long to Mrs. J. E. Scott
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Long is writing "few lines which will bring sorrow and grief upon you and family the death of your Dear Companion J. E. Scott." He tells Mrs. Scott that her husband died on April 6 in an Atlanta hosspital. Long goes on to say that he is sending the soldier's personal effects: fifty dollars in U.S. money, blanket, comb, pair of shoes, pocket knife, shirt, hat, pants, drawers, and vest. Scott served in Cheatham's Division, Maney's Brigade (Confederate). He was a farmer in civilian life.
